Overload.descr: Math/Money - Returns the absolute value of a specified number.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the access level of the current user for DBF table security.
Arrays - Copies elements from one array to another. Returns the number of elements copied.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse cosine (arccosine) of a number.
Arrays - Deletes an element from a one-dimensional array, or deletes a row or column of elements from a two-dimensional array. Returns 1 if successful, an error if unsuccessful.
Arrays - Stores to a declared array five characteristics of specified files: name, size, date stamp, time stamp, and attribute(s). Returns the number of files whose characteristics are stored.

Arrays - On a WindowsÂ® 95/98/2000/NTsystem, stores to a declared array nine characteristics of specified files: name, size, date stamp, time stamp, attribute(s), alias, creation date, creation time, and last access date. Returns the number of files whose characteristics are stored.
Arrays - Returns the number of a specified element in a one- or two-dimensional array.
Arrays - Stores the current table's structural information to a declared array and returns the number of fields whose characteristics are stored.
Arrays - Inserts a specified value into one or more locations in a declared array, and returns the number of elements inserted.
Arrays - Adds an element, row, or column to an array and returns a numeric value representing the number of added elements.

Arrays - Inserts an element with the value false into a one-dimensional array, or inserts a row or column of elements with the value false into a two-dimensional array. Returns 1 if successful, an error if unsuccessful.
Arrays - Returns the number of elements, rows, or columns of an array.
Xbase - Returns the alias name of the current or a specified work area.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns a character string that is the ANSI equivalent of a character expression using the current global character set.
Arrays - Increases or decreases the size of an array according to the specified dimensions and returns a numeric value representing the number of elements in the modified array.
Core Language - Returns the number of parameters passed to a routine.
Core Language - Returns the specified parameter passed to a routine.
Strings - Returns the numeric ASCII value of a specified character.
Arrays - Searches an array for an expression. Returns the number of the first element that matches the expression if the search is successful, or zero if the search is unsuccessful.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse sine (arcsine) of a number.
Arrays - Sorts the elements in a one-dimensional array or the rows in a two-dimensional array, returning 1 if successful or an error if unsuccessful.
Arrays - Returns the row number or the column number of a specified element in an array.
Strings - Returns a number that represents the position of a string within another string.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse tangent (arctangent) of a number.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse tangent (arctangent) of a given point.
LocalSQL - AVG() returns the average value of a numeric column.
Xbase - Begins transaction logging.
Xbase - Returns the predefined type number of a specified binary field.
Bitwise - Performs a bitwise AND.
Bitwise - Shifts a number's bits to the left.
Bitwise - Inverts the bits in a number
Bitwise - Performs a bitwise OR.
Bitwise - Shifts a number's bits to the right, maintaining sign.
Bitwise - Checks if a specified bit in a numeric value is on.
Bitwise - Performs a bitwise exclusive OR.
Bitwise - Shifts a number's bits to the right.
Xbase - Indicates if the record pointer in a table is at the beginning of the file.
Xbase - Returns a bookmark for the current record.
Date and Time - Returns the name of the day of the week of a specified date.
Math/Money - Returns the nearest integer that is greater than or equal to a specified number.
Strings - Returns a character string that contains a string centered in a line of specified length.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the last compiler error.
Xbase - Returns true if another user has changed a record since it was read from disk.

Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the name of the character set the current table or a specified table is using. If no table is open and you issue CHARSET( ) without an argument, it returns the global character set in use.
Text Streaming - Opens a printer setup dialog box. Returns false if you cancel out of the dialog, true otherwise.Description, can be multi-line
Strings - Returns the character equivalent of a specified ASCII value.
Date and Time - Returns the name of the month of a specified date.
Xbase - Clears the transaction log, committing all logged changes.
Math/Money - Returns the trigonometric cosine of an angle.
LocalSQL - Count(),for counting the number of values in a column that match specified criteria
Xbase Command - Counts the number of records that match specified conditions. See OLH.
OOP - a method implemented differently depending on the object using it. Usage: - <objRef>.count()
Date and Time - Interprets a specified character expression as a literal date.
Date and Time - 'Character to DateTime' converts a literal DateTime string to a DateTime (DT) value.
Date and Time - 'Character to TIME'( ) converts a literal Time string to a Time value.
Xbase - Returns the name of the current database from which tables are accessed.
Date and Time - Returns the system date.
Date and Time - Returns a value representing the current date and time.
Date and Time - Returns the numeric value of the day of the month for a specified date.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the last BDE error.
Xbase - Returns the name of a table open in the current or a specified work area.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the error message of the last BDE error.
Xbase - Indicates if the current record is marked as deleted.
Xbase - Indicates if a specified index is in descending order.
Strings - Returns a number that represents the phonetic difference between two strings.
Files and Operating System - Returns the number of bytes available on the current or specified drive's disk.
Date and Time - Returns a specified date as a character string in DD MONTH YY or DD MONTH YYYY format.
Date and Time - Returns the day of the week corresponding to a specified date as a number from 1 to 7.
Date and Time - Converts a date into a literal date string.
Date and Time - 'Date to DateTime' converts a date to a DateTime value (DT).
Math/Money - Returns the radian value of an angle whose measurement is given in degrees.
Date and Time - Returns a specified date as a character string in YYYYMMDD format.
Date and Time - 'DateTime to Character' converts a DateTime value to a literal DateTime string.
Date and Time - 'DateTime to Date' converts the date component of a DateTime value to a literal Date .
Date and Time - 'DateTime to Time' converts the time component of a DateTime value to a Time value .
Date and Time - Returns the number of seconds elapsed between two specified times.
Core Language - Returns true if a specified expression is empty.
Core Language - Returns a listing of the member names of an object.
Xbase - Indicates if the record pointer is at the end-of-file.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the most recent dBASE Plus error.
Math/Money - Returns e raised to a specified power.

LocalSQL - Local SQL supports the EXTRACT( ) function for isolating a single numeric field from a date/time field on retrieval using the following syntax: EXTRACT (<extract field> FROM <field name>) See OLH for more information
File Information Functions - Returns the last date a file was opened.
Low-level File Functions - Closes a file previously opened with FCREATE()
Xbase - Returns the number of fields in a table.
Low-level File Functions - Creates and opens a specified file.
File Information Functions - Returns the date a file was created.
File Information Functions - Returns the time a file was created.
File Information Functions - Returns the date stamp for a file, the date the file was last modified.
Xbase - Returns the number of decimal places in a specified field of a table.
Low-level File Functions - Returns true if the file pointer is at the end of a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN()

Low-level File Functions - Returns the error number of the most recent byte-level input or output error, or 0 if the most recent byte-level method was successful. Used in a TRY and CATCH block to get the error number. See OLH
Low-level File Functions - Writes to disk a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN() without closing the file. Returns true if successful and false if unsuccessful.
Low-level File Functions - Returns a line of text from a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN().
Xbase - Returns the name of the field in a specified position of a table.
Files and Operating System - Tests for the existence of a file. Returns true if the file exists and false if it doesn't. Both options need to be enclosed in quotes
Core Language - Returns an object of the specified class from the object heap.
Xbase - Returns the number of fields in a table. Same as FCOUNT()
Xbase - Returns the fields and calculated field expressions of a SET FIELDS TO list.
Xbase - Returns the length of the field in a specified position of a table.
Xbase - Locks a table.
Math/Money - Returns the nearest integer that is less than or equal to a specified number.
Files and Operating System - Returns the maximum allowable file-name length on a given drive or volume. See OLH for more information.
Low-level File Functions - Opens a specified file.
Xbase - Returns the FOR clause of a specified index tag.
Language Definition - Control Statements - Part of a FOR/ENDFOR Loop construct.
Xbase - Indicates if the last-issued search command found a match.
Low-level File Functions - Writes a character string, and one or two end-of-line characters, to a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN(). Returns the number of characters written.
Low-level File Functions - Returns a specified number of characters from a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN().
Low-level File Functions - Moves the file pointer in a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN(), and returns the new position of the file pointer.
File Information Functions - Returns the short (8.3) name of a file.
File Information Functions - Returns the size of a file in bytes.
File Information Functions - Returns the time stamp for a file, the time the file was last modified.
Files and Operating System - Creates a unique file name. Read Documentation for usage
Math/Money - Returns the future value of an investment.
Low-level File Functions - Writes a character string to a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN(). Returns the number of characters written.

Application Shell - Calls a dialog box in which you can define a custom color or select a color from the color palette. Returns a character string containing the red, green, and blue values for the color selected.
Files and Operating System - Displays a dialog box from which you can select a directory for use with subsequent commands.
Files and Operating System - Returns the value of an operating system environment variable.

Files and Operating System - Displays a dialog box from which the user can choose, or enter, an existing file name, and returns this file name. Read Documentation for further options. Parameters with empty angle brackets (< >) will need to have empty quotes if they're not being used. GETFILE() with no parameters brings up a general purpose dialog box.

Param.name: [<file types list expC> | <file type group name expC>(<file types list expC>)]]]

Overload.descr: Files and Operating System - GETFILE(<filename skeleton expC>) - Files to show *.* *.prg etc
Files and Operating System - GETFILE( < >, <title expC>) - Title's the Dialog Box
Files and Operating System - GETFILE(< >, < >, <suppress database expL>) - Database Selector true/false

Files and Operating System - GETFILE(< >, < >, <suppress database expL>, <file types list expC> | <file type group name expC>(<file types list expC>) ) - File type group selection or custom type group with file extension list.

Param.name: <file types list expC> | <file type group name expC>(<file types list expC>)

Files and Operating System - Returns the directory where the PLUS.exe in use is located.
Bitwise - Returns the numeric value of a specified hexadecimal number.

Core Language - Returns one of two values depending on the result of a specified logical expression.
Application Shell - Gets the first keystroke waiting in the keyboard typeahead buffer. Can also be used to wait for a keystroke and return its value.
IDE Language Elements - Opens the Inspector, a window that lists object properties and lets you change their settings.
Math/Money - Returns the integer portion of a specified number
Strings - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic.
Xbase - Determines if a specified field or expression is blank.
Strings - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic and lowercase.
Xbase - Tests for the existence of a table in a specified database.
Strings - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic and uppercase.
Bitwise - Returns the hexadecimal equivalent of a specified number, as a character string.
Xbase - Returns the key expression of the specified index.
Xbase - Indicates if a specified expression is found in an index. Using <exp> only
Xbase - Indicates if a specified expression is found in an index. Using <index position expN>
Xbase - Indicates if a specified expression is found in an index. Using [<.mdx filename expC>]

Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the name of the language driver the current table or a specified table is using. If no table is open and you issue LDRIVER( ) without an argument, it returns the global language driver in use.

Files and Operating System - Displays a dialog box within which the user can choose an exisiting file to overwrite or a new file name, and returns the file name. The function has several parameter options detailed below, but here is the main syntactic options. See OLH for more thorough information and usage. Parameters with empty angle brackets (< >) will need to have empty quotes if they're not being used. PUTFILE([<title expC> [, <filename expC> [, <extension expC> [, <suppress database expL>>], [<file types list expC> | <file group name expC> (<file types list expC>)]]]]) PUTFILE() with no parameters brings up a general use file dialog box.
Files and Operating System - PUTFILE([<title expC>]) - Titles the Dialog Box
Files and Operating System - PUTFILE([ < >, <filename expC>]) - Filename to display in dialog box entryfield
Files and Operating System - PUTFILE([ < >, < >, <extension expC>]) - Filename extension to save with, jpg,prg etc.
Files and Operating System - PUTFILE([ < >, < >, < >, <suppress database expL>]) - Database Selector true/false

Files and Operating System - PUTFILE([ < >, < >, < >, <suppress database expL>, [<file types list expC> | <file group name expC> (<file types list expC>)]]) - File type group selection or custom type group with file extension list.

Method - Abandons any pending changes to the current row. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .abandon() - <oRef> = The rowset whose current row buffer you want to abandon.
Method - Abandons changes to the current record. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .abandonRecord() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.
Method - Abandons all cached updates in the database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .abandonUpdates() - <oRef> = The database whose cached changes you want to abandon.
Math/Money - Returns the absolute value of a specified number.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the access level of the current user for DBF table security.
Method - Returns the access level of the current session for DBF table security. Property of: Session Usage: <oRef> .access() - <oRef> = The session you want to test.

Method - Returns the last date a file was opened. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .accessDate(<filename expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> = The name of the file to check. Wildcard characters are not allowed; you must specify the actual file name.
Arrays - Copies elements from one array to another. Returns the number of elements copied.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse cosine (arccosine) of a number.

Method - Adds an element to a one-dimensional array. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .add(<exp> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the one-dimensional array to which you want to add the element. <exp> = An expression of any type you want to assign to the new element.

Method - Adds a password to the sessionâs password list for DB table security. Property of: <Object> Usage: <oRef> .addPassword(<expC> ) - <oRef> = The session you want to receive the password. <expC> = The password string.

Method - The addToMRU( ) method can be called from a dBL program that runs in the dBASE IDE. If called in a dBASE runtime application, it will RETURN without doing anything. See OLH for full usage information. Property of: _app Usage: _app.addToMRU( <filename> , <launchMode> ) - <oRef> = _app
Arrays - Deletes an element from a one-dimensional array, or deletes a row or column of elements from a two-dimensional array. Returns 1 if successful, an error if unsuccessful.
Arrays - Stores to a declared array five characteristics of specified files: name, size, date stamp, time stamp, and attribute(s). Returns the number of files whose characteristics are stored.

Arrays - On a WindowsÂ® 95/98/2000/NTsystem, stores to a declared array nine characteristics of specified files: name, size, date stamp, time stamp, attribute(s), alias, creation date, creation time, and last access date. Returns the number of files whose characteristics are stored.

Method - Creates a DDE hot link to enable the passing of notification messages whenever a specified topic item changes in the server application. Property of: DDELink Usage: <oRef> .advise(<item expC> ) - <oRef> = DDELink <item expC> = The name of the topic item you want to monitor.
Arrays - Returns the number of a specified element in a one- or two-dimensional array.
Arrays - Stores the current table's structural information to a declared array and returns the number of fields whose characteristics are stored.
Arrays - Inserts a specified value into one or more locations in a declared array, and returns the number of elements inserted.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the mean average for a group. Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agAverage(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value to average.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the number of items in a group. Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agCount(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value you want to count.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the highest value within a group Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agMax(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value you want to track.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the lowest value within a group. Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agMin(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value you want to track.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the standard deviation of the values in a group. Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agStdDeviation(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value you want to sample.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the total of a group. Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agSum(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value you want to total.

Method - Aggregate method that returns the variance of the values in a group. Property of: Group Usage: <oRef> .agVariance(<codeblock> ) - <oRef> = The Group object that defines the group you want to summarize. <codeblock> = A codeblock or pointer to a function that returns the value you want to sample.
Arrays - Adds an element, row, or column to an array and returns a numeric value representing the number of added elements.

Arrays - Inserts an element with the value false into a one-dimensional array, or inserts a row or column of elements with the value false into a two-dimensional array. Returns 1 if successful, an error if unsuccessful.
Arrays - Returns the number of elements, rows, or columns of an array.
Xbase - Returns the alias name of the current or a specified work area.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns a character string that is the ANSI equivalent of a character expression using the current global character set.
Method - Adds rows from one rowset or table to another. Property of: UpdateSet Usage: <oRef>.append() - <oRef> = The UpdateSet object that describes the append.

Method - Updates one rowset or table from another by updating existing rows and adding new rows. Property of: UpdateSet Usage: <oRef>.appendUpdate() - <oRef> = The UpdateSet object that describes the update.
Method - Applies the filter that was set during a rowsetâs Filter mode. Property of:Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef>.applyFilter() - <oRef> = The rowset whose filter criteria you want to apply.

Method - Finds the first row that matches specified criteria. See OLH for further information. ArrayRowset method must use dBL code in the expression. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef>.applyLocate([<SQL condition expC>]) - <oRef> = The rowset you want to search for the specified criteria. <SQL condition expC> = An SQL condition expression.
Method - Attempts to apply all cached updates in the database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef>.applyUpdates() - <oRef> = The database whose cached updates you want to apply.
Arrays - Increases or decreases the size of an array according to the specified dimensions and returns a numeric value representing the number of elements in the modified array.
Core Language - Returns the number of parameters passed to a routine.
Core Language - Returns the specified parameter passed to a routine.

Method - Returns the numeric ASCII value of a specified character. Property of: String Usage: <oRef> .asc(<expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a String object. <expC> = The character whose ASCII value you want to return. You can specify a string with more than one character, but dBASE uses only the first one.
Strings - Returns the numeric ASCII value of a specified character.
Arrays - Searches an array for an expression. Returns the number of the first element that matches the expression if the search is successful, or zero if the search is unsuccessful.

Arrays - Sorts the elements in a one-dimensional array or the rows in a two-dimensional array, returning 1 if successful or an error if unsuccessful.
Arrays - Returns the row number or the column number of a specified element in an array.
Strings - Returns a number that represents the position of a string within another string.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse tangent (arctangent) of a number.
Method - Returns true if the row cursor is at the first row in the rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .atFirst() - <oRef> = The rowset whose position you want to check.
Method - Returns true if the row cursor is at the last row in the rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .atLast() - <oRef> = The rowset whose position you want to check.
Math/Money - Returns the inverse tangent (arctangent) of a given point.
Method - Establishes link between a toolbar and a form. Property of: Toolbar Usage: <toRef> .attach(<oRef> ) - <toRef> = An object reference to the toolbar. <oRef> = An object reference to the form.
LocalSQL - AVG() returns the average value of a numeric column.
Method - Starts append of a new row. Property of: Rowset ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .beginAppend() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to put in Append mode.

Method - Creates a temporary buffer in memory for a record that is based on the structure of the current table, letting the user input data to the record without automatically adding the record to the table. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .beginAppend() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.
Method - Makes contents of a row editable. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .beginEdit() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to put in Edit mode.
Method - Puts a rowset in Filter mode, allowing the entry of filter criteria. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .beginFilter() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to put in Filter mode.
Method - Puts a rowset in Locate mode, allowing the entry of search criteria. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .beginLocate() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to put in Locate mode.
Method - Forces the next band to display in a new StreamFrame. Property of: StreamSource Usage: <oRef> .beginNewFrame() - <oRef> = StreamSource
Xbase - Begins transaction logging.
Method - Begins transaction logging. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .beginTrans() - <oRef> = The database in which you want to start transaction logging.

Method - Returns the current position in a rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .bookmark() - <oRef> = The rowset whose current position you want to return.
Xbase - Returns a bookmark for the current record.

Method - Checks if a given bookmark matches the current row, or if two bookmarks refer to the same row. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .bookmarksEqual(<bookmark1> [, <bookmark2> ]) - <oRef> = The rowset in which to check the bookmark(s). <bookmark1> = The bookmark to check against the current row in the rowset, if only one bookmark is specified; or the first of two bookmarks to compare. <bookmark2> - The second of two bookmarks to compare.

ADO Method - Cancels execution of a pending, asynchronous method call. Property of: ADODatabase, ADOQuery, ADOTable, ADOStoredProc, ADODataShape Usage: <oRef> .cancel() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.
ADOQuery Method - No Current Information Property of: ADOQuery Usage: <oRef> .cancelBatch() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.
Date and Time - Returns the name of the day of the week of a specified date.
Math/Money - Returns the nearest integer that is greater than or equal to a specified number.
Strings - Returns a character string that contains a string centered in a line of specified length.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the last compiler error.
Xbase - Returns true if another user has changed a record since it was read from disk.
ADO Method - No Current Information Property of: ADOUser Usage: <oRef> .changePassword() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.

Method - Returns the character at the specified position in the string. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .charAt(<expN> ) - <expC> = A string <expN> - Index into the string, which is indexed from left to right. The first character of the string is at index 0 and the last character is at index <expC> .length â 1.

Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the name of the character set the current table or a specified table is using. If no table is open and you issue CHARSET( ) without an argument, it returns the global character set in use.

Method - Opens a print setup or print dialog to allow a user to select the printer and set other print or report properties. Property of: Printer class Usage: <oRef> .choosePrinter([<title expC> ][, <expL> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to the printer object whose choosePrinter( ) method you wish to call. <title expC> - Optional custom title for the print or printer setup dialog box. <expL> - If true, choosePrinter( ) will display the 'Print Setup' dialog. If false, choosePrinter( ) will display the standard Windows 'Print' dialog.
Text Streaming - Opens a printer setup dialog box. Returns false if you cancel out of the dialog, true otherwise.Description, can be multi-line

Method - Returns the character equivalent of a specified ASCII value. Property of: String Usage: <oRef> .chr(<expN> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a String object. <expN> - The numeric ASCII value, from 0 to 255, inclusive, whose character equivalent you want to return.
Strings - Returns the character equivalent of a specified ASCII value.
ADO Method - Clears the contents of the stream object. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef>.clear() - <oRef> = The stream object whose the contents to clear.
Method - Clears any active filter on a rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .clearFilter() - <oRef> = The rowset whose filter to clear.
Method - Clears any active range on a rowset. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .clearRange() - <oRef> = The rowset whose range to clear.

Method - Clears manually-set tic marks in a Slider object. Property of: Slider Usage: <oRef> .clearTics(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Slider object whose tics to clear. <expN> - A numeric value, or an expression which evaluates to a numeric value.
ADO Method - Creates a duplicate rowset. Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .clone() - <oRef> = The rowset object to be cloned.

Method - Closes a form. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .close([expX]) - <oRef> = An object reference to the form to close. [expX] - An optional value to be returned by a form opened with readModal( )
Method - Closes a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ). Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .close() - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file.
Method - Closes a database connection. Property of: Database Usage: This method is called implicitly by the Database object.
Date and Time - Returns the name of the month of a specified date.
Method - Clears the transaction log, committing all logged changes Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .commit() - <oRef> = The database whose changes you want to commit.
Xbase - Clears the transaction log, committing all logged changes.
ADO Method - No Current Information Property of: ADOTableDef Usage: <oRef> .compare() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.

Method - Copies selected text to the Windows clipboard. Property of: Browse, ComboBox, Editor, Entryfield, SpinBox Usage: <oRef> .copy() - <oRef> = An object reference to the control from which to copy the text.

Method - Duplicates a specified file. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .copy(<filename expC> , <new name expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - Identifies the file to duplicate (also known as the source file). <new name expC> - Identifies the target file that will be created or overwritten by copy( ).
Method - Copies a rowset or table to a new table. Property of: UpdateSet Usage: <oRef> .copy() - <oRef> = The UpdateSet object that describes the copy.

Method - Makes a copy of one table to create another table in the same database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .copyTable(<source table expC> , <destination table expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which you want to copy the table. <source table expC> - The name of the table you want to duplicate. <destination table expC> - The name of the table you want to create.

Method - Copies the contents of a BLOB field to a new file. Property of: Field Usage: <oRef> .copyToFile(<file name expC> ) - <oRef> = The BLOB field to copy. <file name expC> - The name of the file you want to create.

ADO Method - Copies the binary contents to another stream object. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef> .copyToStream(<stream expO> [,<num expN> ]) - <oRef> = The stream object to be copied. <stream expO> - The reference to the another stream object. [<num expN> ] - The number of characters or bytes to be copied from the current position in the source stream to the destination stream. If omitted, all characters or bytes are copied from the current position to EOS.
Math/Money - Returns the trigonometric cosine of an angle.
LocalSQL - Count(),for counting the number of values in a column that match specified criteria
Xbase Command - Counts the number of records that match specified conditions. See OLH.
Method - Returns the number of rows in a rowset, respecting any filter conditions and events. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .count() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to measure

Method - Returns the number of prompts in a listbox, or the number of items in a tree. Property of: ListBox, TreeView Usage: <oRef> .count() - <oRef> = An object reference to the listbox or tree whose items to count.
Method - Returns the number of elements in an associative array. Property of: AssocArray Usage: <oRef> .count() - <oRef> = <object referred to>

Method - Creates and opens a specified file. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .create(<filename expC> [, <access expC> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - The name of the file to create and open. [<access expC> ] - The access level of the file to create, as shown in the OLH.

ADO Method - Creates a new catalog for a new database Property of: ADODatabase Usage: <oRef> .createCatalog([<string expC> ]) - <oRef> = The database in which you want to create catalog. [<string expC> ] - Optional, the connection string for not existing yet database.
Method - Returns the date a file was created. Property of: File Usage: <oRef>.createDate(<filename expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - The name of the file to check.

Method - The createIndex( ) method creates an index for a specified table. See OLH for futher details. Property of: Database Usage: createIndex (<tablename expC> ,<oRef> ) - <tablename expC> = The name of the table on which you want to create the index. <oRef> - Predefined .dbf index object
Method - Returns the time a file was created. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .createTime(<filename expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - The name of the file to check.
Date and Time - Interprets a specified character expression as a literal date.
Date and Time - 'Character to DateTime' converts a literal DateTime string to a DateTime (DT) value.
Date and Time - 'Character to TIME'( ) converts a literal Time string to a Time value.

Method - Cuts selected text and places it on the Windows Clipboard. Property of: Browse, ComboBox, Editor, Entryfield, SpinBox Usage: <oRef> .cut() - <oRef> = An object reference to the control from which to cut the text.
Xbase - Returns the name of the current database from which tables are accessed.
Date and Time - Returns the system date.
Date and Time - Returns a value representing the current date and time.
Date and Time - Returns the numeric value of the day of the month for a specified date.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the last BDE error.
Xbase - Returns the name of a table open in the current or a specified work area.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the error message of the last BDE error.
Method - Deletes the current row. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .delete() - <oRef> = The rowset whose current row you want to delete.

Method - Deletes an element from a one-dimensional array, or deletes a row or column of elements from a two-dimensional array. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .delete(<position expN> [, <row/column expN> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to the one- or two-dimensional array from which you want to delete data. <position expN> - When the array is a one-dimensional array, <position expN> specifies the number of the element to delete. When the array is a two-dimensional array, <position expN> specifies the number of the row or column whose elements you want to delete. [<row/column expN> ] - Either 1 or 2. If you omit this argument or specify 1, a row is deleted from a two-dimensional array. If you specify 2, a column is deleted.

Method - Removes a file from a disk, optionally sending it to the Recycle Bin. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .delete(<filename expC> [, <recycle expL> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - Identifies the file to remove. [<recycle expL> ] - Whether to send the file to the Recycle Bin instead of deleting it. If omitted, the file is deleted.
Method - Deletes the rows in the destination that are listed in the source. Property of: UpdateSet Usage: <oRef> .delete() - <oRef> = The UpdateSet object that describes the delete.
Xbase - Indicates if the current record is marked as deleted.
Xbase - Indicates if a specified index is in descending order.
Method - Breaks links between a toolbar and a form. Property of: Toolbar Usage: <toRef> .detach(<oRef> ) - <toRef> = An object reference to the toolbar. <oRef> - An object reference to the form.
Strings - Returns a number that represents the phonetic difference between two strings.

Method - Fills the array with five characteristics of specified files: name, size, modified date, modified time, and file attribute(s). Returns the number of files whose characteristics are stored. See OLH. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .dir([<filename skeleton expC> [, <DOS file attribute list expC> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the array in which you want to store the file information. [<filename skeleton expC> - The file-name pattern (using wildcards) describing the files whose information you want to store to <oRef> . [<DOS file attribute list expC> ]] - The letter or letters D, H, S, and/or V representing one or more file attributes.

Method - dirExt( ) is an extended version of the dir( ) method. It fills the array with nine characteristics of specified files: name, size, modified date, modified time, file attribute(s), short (8.3) file name, create date, create time, and access date. Returns the number of files whose characteristics are stored. See OLH. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .dirExt([<filename skeleton expC> [, <file attribute list expC> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the array in which you want to store the file information. [<filename skeleton expC> - The file-name pattern (using wildcards) describing the files whose information you want to store to <oRef> . [<file attribute list expC> ]] - The letter or letters D, H, S, and/or V representing one or more file attributes.
Files and Operating System - Returns the number of bytes available on the current or specified drive's disk.
Date and Time - Returns a specified date as a character string in DD MONTH YY or DD MONTH YYYY format.

Method - Starts an action in an OLE server application. Property of: OLE Usage: <oRef> .doVerb(<verb expN> [, <title expC> ]) - <oRef> = The OLE control that contains the linked or embedded object. <verb expN> - The numeric value of the OLE verb. [<title expC> ] - An optional text string to display in the title bar of the server window.
Date and Time - Returns the day of the week corresponding to a specified date as a number from 1 to 7.

Method - Initiates a Drag&Drop Copy or Move operation for a dBASE UI object. Property of: Many Form objects Usage: <oRef> .drag(<type expc> , <name expC> , <icon expC> ) - <oRef> = The object to be copied or moved. <type expc> - A string, typically identifying the object's type. <name expC> - A string, typically containing the name of the object. <icon expC> - The filename of a cursor icon to be displayed while the object is being dragged. This parameter is required, but is currently unused. The default Windows OLE cursor will be displayed.

Method - The dropIndex( ) method deletes an index for a specified table Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .dropIndex (<tablename expC> ,<indexName expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which the table exists. <tablename expC> - The name of the table containing the index <indexName expC> - The index tag name

Method - Deletes (drops) a table from a database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .dropTable(<table name expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which the table exists. <table name expC> - The name of the table you want to delete.
Date and Time - Converts a date into a literal date string.
Date and Time - 'Date to DateTime' converts a date to a DateTime value (DT).
Math/Money - Returns the radian value of an angle whose measurement is given in degrees.
Date and Time - Returns a specified date as a character string in YYYYMMDD format.
Date and Time - 'DateTime to Character' converts a DateTime value to a literal DateTime string.
Date and Time - 'DateTime to Date' converts the date component of a DateTime value to a literal Date .
Date and Time - 'DateTime to Time' converts the time component of a DateTime value to a Time value .
Date and Time - Returns the number of seconds elapsed between two specified times.

Method - Returns the number of a specified element in a one- or two-dimensional array. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .element(<subscript1 expN> [, <subscript2 expN> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to a one- or two-dimensional array. <subscript1 expN> - The first subscript of the element. In a one-dimensional array, this is the same as the element number. In a two-dimensional array, this is the row. [<subscript2 expN> ] - When <oRef> is a two-dimensional array, <subscript2 expN> specifies the second subscript, or column, of the element. If <oRef> is a two-dimensional array and you do not specify a value for <subscript2 expN> , dBASE assumes the value 1, the first column in the row.
Core Language - Returns true if a specified expression is empty.

Method - Deletes all the rows in a table. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .emptyTable(<table name expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which the table exists. <table name expC> - The name of the table you want to empty.
Method - Makes the tree item visible in the tree view. Property of: TreeItem Usage: <oRef> .ensureVisible() - <oRef> = An object reference to the tree item you want to display.
Core Language - Returns a listing of the member names of an object.

Method - Returns true if the file pointer is at the end of a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ) Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .eof() - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file.
Xbase - Indicates if the record pointer is at the end-of-file.

Method - Returns the error number of the most recent byte-level input or output error, or 0 if the most recent byte-level method was successful. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .error() - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that attempted the operation.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the most recent dBASE Plus error.
Method - Executes a query or stored procedure. Property of: Query, StoredProc Usage: This method is called implicitly by the Query or StoredProc object.

Method - Sends a command string to a DDE server application in its own language. Property of: DDELink Usage: <oRef> .execute(<cmd expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the DDELink object that has the link. <cmd expC> - Command or macro to send to the DDE server application.

Method - Use the executeMessages( ) method to periodically process pending messages while running a lengthy processing routine. Property of: _app Usage: <oRef> .executeMessages() - <oRef> = A reference to the _app object

Method - Executes the specified SQL statement. Property of: <Object> Usage: <oRef> .executeSQL(<SQL expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which you want to execute the SQL statement. <SQL expC> - The SQL statement.

Method - Tests for the existence of a file. Returns true if the file exists and false if it doesnât. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .exists(<filename expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - The name of the file to search for. Wildcard characters are not allowed; you must specify the actual file name.
Math/Money - Returns e raised to a specified power.
File Information Functions - Returns the last date a file was opened.
Low-level File Functions - Closes a file previously opened with FCREATE()
Xbase - Returns the number of fields in a table.
Low-level File Functions - Creates and opens a specified file.
File Information Functions - Returns the date a file was created.
File Information Functions - Returns the time a file was created.
File Information Functions - Returns the date stamp for a file, the date the file was last modified.
Xbase - Returns the number of decimal places in a specified field of a table.
Low-level File Functions - Returns true if the file pointer is at the end of a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN()

Low-level File Functions - Returns the error number of the most recent byte-level input or output error, or 0 if the most recent byte-level method was successful. Used in a TRY and CATCH block to get the error number. See OLH
Low-level File Functions - Writes to disk a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN() without closing the file. Returns true if successful and false if unsuccessful.
Low-level File Functions - Returns a line of text from a file previously opened with FCREATE() or FOPEN().
Xbase - Returns the name of the field in a specified position of a table.

Method - Fills the array with the current table's structural information. Returns the number of fields whose characteristics are stored. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .fields() - <oRef> = A reference to the array in which you want to store the field information.
Files and Operating System - Tests for the existence of a file. Returns true if the file exists and false if it doesn't. Both options need to be enclosed in quotes

Method - Stores a specified value into one or more locations in an array, and returns the number of elements stored. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .fill(<exp> [, <start expN> [, <count expN> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to a one- or two-dimensional array you want to fill with the specified value <exp> . <exp> - An expression you want to store in the specified array. [<start expN> - The element number at which you want to begin storing <exp> . If you do not specify <start expN> , dBASE begins at the first element in the array. [<count expN> ]]The number of elements in which you want to store <exp> , starting at element <start expN> . If you do not specify <count expN> , dBASE stores <exp> from <start expN> to the last element in the array. If you want to specify a value for <count expN> , you must also specify a value for <start expN> . If you do not specify <start expN> or <count expN> , dBASE fills all elements in the array with <exp> .
ADO Method - Unsure of availability Property of: ADOChapterArray Usage: <oRef> .find(<code expC> ) - <oRef> = ADOChapterArray.
ADO Method - currently unavailable Property of: ADOErrorArray Usage: <oRef> .find(<code expC> ) - <oRef> = ADOErrorArray.
ADO Method - Unsure of availability Property of: ADOParameterArray Usage: <oRef> .find(<name expC> ) - <oRef> = ADOParameterArray.

Method - Finds the row with the exact matching key value. Documentation is sketchy if acccurate at all. (sorry) Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .findKey(<key exp> | <keys expA> ) - <oRef> = ADORowset in which to do the search <key exp> | - The value to search for. <keys expA> - The values in an Array(?) to search for.

Method - Finds the row with the nearest matching key value. Documentation is sketch if accurate at all. (Sorry) Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .findKeyNearest(<key exp> | <keys expA> ) - <oRef> = ADORowset in which to do the search <key exp> | - The value to search for. <keys expA> - The values in an Array(?) to search for.

Method - Moves the row cursor to the first row in the rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .first() - <oRef> = The rowset in which you want to move the row cursor.
Method - Returns a bookmark for the row currently displayed in the first row of the grid. Property of: Grid Usage: <oRef> .firstRow() - <oRef> = A reference to a grid object.

Xbase - Returns the length of the field in a specified position of a table.
Xbase - Locks a table.

Method - Returns the value of the byte at the specified index in the string. The first byte is at index number zero.

Application Shell - Calls a dialog box in which you can define a custom color or select a color from the color palette. Returns a character string containing the red, green, and blue values for the color selected.

Method - Displays a dialog box from which a user can select multiple files. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef>.getFile() - <oRef> = A reference to the array in which the selected filenames, or database aliases, will be stored. <oRef>.getfile() with no parameters brings up a general purpose dialog box. Parameters with empty angle brackets (<>) will need to have empty quotes if they're not being used. Filled angle brackets must be filled with value. See OLH.
