Method - Returns an object reference to a TreeItem object located at a specified position. Property of: TreeView Usage:[<oRef> =] getItemByPos( <col expN> , <row expN> ) - <oRef> = A variable or property in which to store the TreeItem object reference returned by getItemByPos( ). <col expN> - The horizontal position, within a TreeView object, to check for a TreeItem. <row expN> - The vertical position, within a TreeView object, to check for a TreeItem.
Method - Returns the minutes portion of a date object. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .getMinutes() - <oRef> = The date object whose minutes you want to return.
Method - Returns the number of the month for a specified date. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .getMonth() - <oRef> = The Date object whose corresponding month number you want to return.
ADO Method - Listed, but undocumented Property of: ADOUser Listed, but undocumented Usage: <oRef> .getPermissions() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.

Method - Returns information about a database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .getSchema(<item expC> ) - <oRef> = The database you want to get information about. <item expC> - The information to retrieve, which may be one of the following strings (which are not case-sensitive): See OLH for more information

Method - Returns information about a database. Property of: ADODatabase Usage: <oRef> .getSchema([<schema expC> ][<guid expC> ][,<criteria expA> ]) - <oRef> = The database you want to get information about. [<schema expC> ] - The schema type name. [<guid expC> ] - The GUID of schema. [<criteria expA> ] - Optional, the criteria for restriction columns.
Method - Returns the seconds portion of a date object. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .getSeconds() - <oRef> = The date object whose seconds you want to return.

Method - Returns the length of a text string based on the current font settings of the Text or TextLabel control. Property of: Text, TextLabel Usage: <oRef> .getTextExtent(<expC> ) - <oRef> = The Text or TextLabel object used to calculate the text size. <expC> - The string to measure
Method - Returns time equivalent of date/time, in milliseconds. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .getTime() - <oRef> = The Date object whose time equivalent you want to return.

Method - Returns the time zone offset for a date object in the current locale, in minutes. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .getTimezoneOffset() - <oRef> = A date object created in the locale in question.
Method - Returns the year of a specified date. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .getYear() - <oRef> = The Date object whose corresponding year number you want to return.

Method - Returns a line of text from a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ). Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .gets([<characters expN> [, <end-of-line expC> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file. [<characters expN> - The number of characters to read and return before a carriage return is reached. [<end-of-line expC> ] - The end-of-line indicator, which can be a string of one or two characters. If omitted, the default is a hard carriage return and line feed. See OLH for further options and information

Method - Moves the row cursor to a specific row in the rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .goto(<bookmark> ) - <oRef> = The rowset in which you want to move the row cursor. <bookmark> - The bookmark you want to move to.

Method - Adds an element, row, or column to an array and returns the number of added elements. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .grow(<expN> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a one- or two-dimensional array you want to add elements to. <expN> - Either 1 or 2. When you specify 1, grow( ) adds a single element to a one-dimensional array or a row to a two-dimensional array. When you specify 2, grow( ) adds a column to the array.
Method - <description> Property of: _app.frameWin Usage: <oRef> .hasHScrollBar() - <oRef> = a reference to the _app.FrameWin object.

Method - Use the hasVScrollBar( ) method to determine if a frame window is using a vertical scrollbar. Property of: _app.frameWin Usage: <oRef> .hasVScrollBar() - <oRef> = a reference to the _app.FrameWin object.
Files and Operating System - Returns the directory where the PLUS.exe in use is located.
Bitwise - Returns the numeric value of a specified hexadecimal number.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the name of the current user on a local area network (LAN) or other multiuser system.
Core Language - Returns one of two values depending on the result of a specified logical expression.

Method - Returns a number that represents the position of a string within another string. Property of: String Usage: <target expC> .indexOf(<search expC> [, <from index expN> ]) - <target expC> = The string in which you want to search for <search expC> . <search expC> - The string you want to search for in <target expC> . [<from index expN> ] - Where you want to start searching for the string. By default, dBASE starts searching at the beginning of the string, index 0.

Method - Starts a conversation with an external application or aliased DDE server. Property of: DDELink Usage: <oRef> .initiate(<server expC> , <topic expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the DDELink object through which you want to initiate the DDE link. <server expC> - The executable filename of the server application (normally the .EXE extension isnât necessary) or the alias name of a running DDE server. <topic expC> - Name of a built-in DDE topic, document, or other topic.
Application Shell - Gets the first keystroke waiting in the keyboard typeahead buffer. Can also be used to wait for a keystroke and return its value.

Method - Inserts an element with the value false into a one-dimensional array, or inserts a row or column of elements with the value false into a two-dimensional array. Returns 1 if successful; generates an error if unsuccessful. The dimensions of the array do not change, so the element(s) at the end of the array will be lost. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .insert(<position expN> [, <row/column expN> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to a one- or two-dimensional array in which you want to insert data. <position expN> - When <oRef> is a one-dimensional array, <position expN> specifies the number of the element in which you want to insert a false value. When <oRef> is a two-dimensional array, <position expN> specifies the number of a row or column in which you want to insert false values. The second argument (discussed in the next paragraph) specifies whether <position expN> is a row or a column. [<row/column expN> ] - Either 1 or 2. If you omit this argument or specify 1, a row is inserted into a two-dimensional array. If you specify 2, a column is inserted. dBASE generates an error if you use <row/column expN> with a one-dimensional array.
IDE Language Elements - Opens the Inspector, a window that lists object properties and lets you change their settings.
Math/Money - Returns the integer portion of a specified number

Method - Method to determine if a database alias exists. Returns True if the alias exists, and false if it does not. Property of: Session Usage: <oRef> .isAlias(<cAliasName> ,<nConfigMode> ) - <oRef> = An object reference to the form. <cAliasName> - The alias name you want to check. <nConfigMode> - optionally takes a second parameter specifying the configmode to use. defaults to checking with configmode of All (7) - See OLH for further options and information
Strings - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic.
Method - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .isAlpha() - <expC> = The string you want to test.
Xbase - Determines if a specified field or expression is blank.

Method - Returns true if the object reference passed in to it refers to an object that is part of a superclass, otherwise, the isInherited( ) method returns false. Property of: Designer Usage: <oRef1> .isInherited(<oRef2> ) - <oRef1> = An object reference to a designer object. <oRef2> - An object reference to an object contained within the Form, Report, or Datamodule currently loaded into the designer object (oRef1).

Method - Returns a logical value that indicates if the specified character expression is the key of an element in an associative array. Property of: AssocArray Usage: <oRef> .isKey(<expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the associative array you want to search. <expC> - The character string you want to find.

Method - Returns true or false to let you know if additional pages are due to be rendered. Property of: Report Usage: <oRef> .isLastPage() - <oRef> = An object reference to the report you want to check. See OLH.
Strings - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic and lowercase.
Method - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic and lowercase. Property of: String Usage: <oRef> .isLower() - <oRef> = The string you want to test.

Method - Returns a logical value that indicates whether data in the current record buffer has been modified. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .isRecordChanged() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.
Method - Returns a logical value indicating whether the current rowset has locked the current row. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .isRowLocked() - <oRef> = An object reference to the rowset.
Method - Returns a logical value indicating whether the current rowset is locked. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .isSetLocked() - <oRef> = An object reference to the rowset.
Xbase - Tests for the existence of a table in a specified database.
Strings - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic and uppercase.
Method - Returns true if the first character of a string is alphabetic and uppercase. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .isUpper() - <expC> = The string you want to test.
Bitwise - Returns the hexadecimal equivalent of a specified number, as a character string.
Xbase - Returns the key expression of the specified index.

Method - Stuffs a character string into an edit control, simulating typed user input. Property of: Browse, ComboBox, Editor, Entryfield, SpinBox Usage: <oRef> .keyboard(<keystroke expC> ) - <oRef> = The control to receive the keystrokes. <keystroke expC> - A string, which may include key codes.
Xbase - Indicates if a specified expression is found in an index. Using <var exp> only
Xbase - Indicates if a specified expression is found in an index. Using <index position expN>
Xbase - Indicates if a specified expression is found in an index. Using [<.mdx filename expC>]
Method - Moves the row cursor to the last row in the rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .last() - <oRef> = The rowset in which you want to move the row cursor.

Method - Returns a number that represents the starting position of a string within another string. lastIndexOf( ) searches backward from the right end of the target string, and returns a value counting from the beginning of the target. Property of: String Usage: <target expC> .lastIndexOf(<search expC> [, <from index expN> ]) - <target expC> = The string in which you want to search for <search expC> . <search expC> - The string you want to search for in <target expC> . [<from index expN> ] - Where you want to start searching for the string. By default, dBASE starts searching at the end of the string, index <target expC> .length â 1.
Method - Returns a bookmark for the row currently displayed in the last row of the grid. Property of: Grid Usage: <oRef> .lastRow() - <oRef> = A reference to a grid object.

Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the name of the language driver the current table or a specified table is using. If no table is open and you issue LDRIVER( ) without an argument, it returns the global language driver in use.

Method - Returns a specified number of characters from the beginning of a character string. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .left(<expN> ) - <expC> = The string from which you want to extract characters. <expN> - The number of characters to extract from the beginning of the string.
Strings - Returns a specified number of characters from the beginning of a string.
Method - Returns a string with no leading space characters. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .leftTrim() - <expC> = The string from which you want to remove the leading space characters.
Strings - Returns the number of characters in a specified character string.
Strings - Returns the display length (in characters) of a numeric expression.
Strings - Returns true if a specified string matches a specified skeleton string.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the number of the current program line in the current program, procedure, or user-defined function (UDF).
Xbase - Returns information about a locked record or file.

Method - Attaches source data array to arrayRowset, Creates field objects for array columns and initializes arrayRowset internal properties. Property of: ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .load(<oArray> [, <oColumnInfo> ]) - <oRef> = ArrayRowset to load to. Listed, not fully documented. <oArray> - source data array. (guess) [<oColumnInfo> ] - source Column Info (guess)
ADO Method - listed, not documented Property of: ADOTableDef Usage: <oRef> .load() - <oRef> = ADOTableDef

Method - Loads and instantiates TreeItems from a text file. Property of: TreeView Usage: <oRef> .loadChildren(<filename expC> ) - <oRef> = The TreeView object to contain the TreeItems. <filename expC> - The name of the text file containing the TreeItem objects and properties.

ADO Method - Loads the contents of a file into a stream object. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef> .loadFromFile(<name expC> ) - <oRef> = The stream object. <name expC> - The name of a file to be loaded into the stream object, can contain any valid path and name in UNC format.

Method - Applies the locate criteria again to search for another row. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .locateNext([<rows expN> ]) - <oRef> = The rowset in which to move the row cursor. [<rows expN> ] - The nth row to find. By default, the next row forward.
Xbase - Locks the current record or a specified list of records in a table.
Xbase - Locks the current record or a specified list of records in a table.
Method - Attempts to lock the current row. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .lockRow() - <oRef> = The rowset in which you want to lock the current row.
Method - Attempts to lock the entire rowset. Property of:Rowset Usage: <oRef> .lockSet() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to lock.
Math/Money - Returns the logarithm to the base e (natural logarithm) of a specified number.
Math/Money - Returns the logarithm to the base 10 of a specified number.

Method - Logs in user to DBF table security for a session. Property of: Session Usage: <oRef> .login(<group name expC> , <user name expC> , <password expC> ) - <oRef> = The session to log into. <group name expC> - The group name. <user name expC> - The user name. <password expC> - The password.
Xbase - Searches a field for a specified expression and, if the expression is found, returns the value of a field within the same record.
LocalSQL - LOWER( ), to force a string to lowercase:
Strings - Converts all uppercase characters in a string to lowercase and returns the resulting string.
Strings - Returns a string with no leading space characters.
Xbase - Returns the date of the last change to a table.
LocalSQL - Compares provided expression and returns the largest column value. See OLH for LocalSQL usage and SQL documentation for full syntax
Xbase - Compares two numbers (or two date, character, or logical expressions) and returns the greater value.
Xbase - Returns the names of a DBF tableâs open .MDX index files.
Date and Time - Returns a specified date as a character string in MONTH DD, YY format.
Xbase - Returns the number of lines in a memo field.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the amount of currently available memory.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the error message of the most recent dBASE error.
LocalSQL - Compares provided expression and returns the smaller column value. See OLH for LocalSQL usage and SQL documentation for full syntax
Xbase - Compares two numbers (or two date, character, or logical expressions) and returns the lesser value.
Xbase - Extracts a specified line of text from a memo field in the current record.
Math/Money - Returns the modulus (remainder) of one number divided by another.
Date and Time - Returns the number of the month for a specified date.

Method - Repositions and resizes an object. Property of: Most form objects Usage: <oRef> .move(<left expN> [, <top expN> [, <width expN> [, <height expN> ]]]) - <oRef> = The object to move or resize. <left expN> - The new left property. [<top expN> - The new top property. [<width expN> - The new width property. To change the size of the image, you must specify both the <left expN> and the <top expN> . [<height expN> ]]] - The new height property.
Application Shell - Opens a dialog box that displays a message and pushbuttons, and returns a numeric value that corresponds to the pushbutton the user chooses.
Xbase - Returns the names of a DBF tableâs open .NDX files.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns true if dBASE is running on a system in which a local area network (LAN) card or other multiuser system card has been installed.

Method - Moves the row cursor to another row relative to the current position. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .next([<rows expN> ]) - <oRef> = The rowset in which you want to move the row cursor. [<rows expN> ] - The number of rows you want to move. By default, the next row forward.

Method - Returns the key name of the element following the specified key in an associative array. Property of: AssocArray Usage: <oRef> .nextKey(<key expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the associative array that contains the key. <key expC> - An existing key name.
Method - Notifies all interested client applications that a dBASE item was changed. Property of: DDETopic Usage: <oRef> .notify(<item expC> ) - <oRef> = <object referred to> <item expC> -
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns a character string using the current global language driver that is the equivalent of an ANSI character expression.
Method - Opens a form. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .open() - <oRef> = The form to open.

Method - Opens a specified file. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .open(<filename expC> [, <access expC> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - The name of the file to open. [<access expC> ] - The access level of the file being opened, as shown in the following table. See OLH for futher information.
Method - Opens a database connection. Property of: Database Usage: This method is called implicitly by the Database object.
ADO Method - Opens a data object. Property of: ADOChapter, ADODatabase, ADODataShape, ADOPersist, ADOQuery, ADOStoredProc, ADOTable Usage: <oRef> .open() - <oRef> = object to open.

ADO Method - Opens a stream object. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef> .open([<source expC> ][,<user expC> ][,<pass expC> ]) - <oRef> = The stream object to be opened. [<source expC> ] - You can specify the source of data for stream object, may contain the path and name of the file ('C:\source.txt') See OLH for further information. [<user expC> ] - The user identification that, if it is needed, accesses the stream object. [<pass expC> ] - The password that, if it is needed, accesses the stream object.
Xbase - Returns the name of the current master index.
ADOField Method - Returns the original value of a field. Property of: ADOField Usage: <oRef> .originalValue() - <oRef> = ADOField. Listed, not documented.
Files and Operating System - Returns the name and version number of the current operating system.

Method - Packs a Standard table by removing all deleted rows. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .packTable(<table name expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which the table exists. <table name expC> - The name of the table you want to pack.
Method - Returns the highest numbered page used in a form. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .pageCount() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form you want to check.

Method - Returns time equivalent of a date/time string, in milliseconds. Property of: Date Usage: Date.parse(<date expC> ) - <oRef> = Date object. <date expC> - The date/time string you want to convert.

Method - Copies text from the Windows clipboard to the control. Property of: Browse, ComboBox, Editor, Entryfield, SpinBox Usage: <oRef> .paste() - <oRef> = An object reference to the control in which to paste the text.
Math/Money - Returns the periodic amount required to repay a debt.
Text Streaming - Returns the printing column position of a printer. Column numbers begin at 0.line
Core Language - Returns the number of parameters passed to a routine.

Method - Retrieves a data item from a DDE server. Property of: DDELink Usage: <oRef> .peek(<item expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the DDELink object that has the link. <item expC> - The name of the desired item.
Math/Money - Returns the approximate value of pi, the ratio of a circleâs circumference to its diameter.

Method - Sends data to a DDE server. Property of: DDELink Usage: <oRef> .poke(<item expC> , <value expC> ) - <oRef> = reference to the DDELink object that has the link. <item expC> - The name of the desired item. <value expC> - The value you want to send (as a string).
Method - Prepares an SQL statement or stored procedure. Property of: Query, StoredProc Usage: <oRef> .prepare() - <oRef> = The object you want to prepare.

Method - Prints a form as it appears on screen, or prints only the data from a completed form Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .print([<dialog expL> [, <mode expL> ]]) - <oRef> = An object reference to the form you want to print. See OLH for more information. [<dialog expL> - An optional parameter that determines whether to display the standard print dialog. If omitted, the dialog is displayed by default. [<mode expL> ]] - An optional parameter that selects which method to use when printing.
Text Streaming - Returns true if the print device is ready to accept output.
Core Language - Returns the number of references to a procedure file.
Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the name of the currently executing program, procedure, or user-defined function (UDF).
Strings - Converts a character string to proper-noun format and returns the resulting string.
Text Streaming - Returns the printing row position of a printer. Row numbers begin at 0.

Files and Operating System - Displays a dialog box within which the user can choose an exisiting file to overwrite or a new file name, and returns the file name. The function has several parameter options detailed below, but here is the main syntactic options. See OLH. Parameters with empty angle brackets (<> ) will need to have empty quotes if they're not being used. putfile() with no parameters brings up a general use file dialog box.
Files and Operating System - putfile([<title expC>]) - Titles the Dialog Box
Files and Operating System - putfile([ < >, <filename expC>]) - Filename to display in dialog box entryfield
Files and Operating System - putfile([ <>, <>, <extension expC>]) - Filename extension to save with, jpg,prg etc.
Files and Operating System - putfile([<>, <>, <>, <suppress database expL>]) - Database Selector true/false

Files and Operating System - putfile([<>, <>, <>, <suppress database expL>, [<file types list expC> | <file group name expC> (<file types list expC>)]]) - File type group selection or custom type group with file extension list.

Param.name: <file types list expC> | <file group name expC> (<file types list expC>)

Overload.descr: Method - Writes a character string, and one or two end-of-line characters, to a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ). Returns the number of characters written. See OLH for more information. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .puts(<string expC> [, <characters expN> [, <end-of-line expC> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file. <string expC> - The character expression to write to the specified file. If you want to write only a portion of <string expC> to the file, use the <characters expN> argument. [<characters expN> - The number of characters of the specified character expression <string expC> to write to the specified file, starting at the first character in <string expC> . If omitted, the entire string is written. [<end-of-line expC> ]] - The end-of-line indicator, which can be a string of one or two characters. If omitted, the default is a hard carriage return and line feed.
Math/Money - Returns the present value of an investment.
Math/Money - Returns a pseudo-random number between 0 and 1 exclusive (never 0 and never 1). Same as RAND( )

Strings - Returns a number that represents the starting position of a string within another string. RAT( ) searches backward from the right end of the target string, and returns a value counting from the beginning of the target.

Method - Returns a specified number of characters from a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ). Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .read(<characters expN> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file. <characters expN>

ADO Method - Reads character or binary data from a stream object. Listed, not well documented. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef>.read([<num expN>]) - <oRef> = The stream object. [<num expN>] - The number of characters or bytes; may contain the negative constant : -1 (Reads all characters or bytes from the stream, from the current position to EOS) (Default) -2 (Reads the next line, seperated by lineSeparator type, from the text streams)

Method - Returns a line of text from a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ). Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .readln([<characters expN> [, <end-of-line expC> ]]) - <oRef> = File object being read from. [<characters expN> - The number of characters to read and return before a carriage return is reached. [<end-of-line expC> ]] - The end-of-line indicator, which can be a string of one or two characters. If omitted, the default is a hard carriage return and line feed. See OLH and gets() for further information.
Method - Opens a form as a modal window and returns an optional value. Property of: Form Usage: <oRef> .readModal() - <oRef> = The form to open.
Xbase - Returns the number of records in a table.
Xbase - For DBF tables, returns the current record number. For all other table types, returns a bookmark of the current position in a table.
Method - Attempts to restart a terminated conversation with a DDE server application. Property of: DDELink Usage: <oRef> .reconnect() - <oRef> = A reference to the DDELink object that had the link.
Xbase - Returns the number of bytes in a record of a table.
Method - Re-executes the report. Property of: ReportViewer Usage: <oRef> .reExecute() - <oRef> = The ReportViewer object that contains the report to re-execute.
Core Language - Returns the number of references to an object.
Method - Refreshes data in the entire rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .refresh() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to refresh.
Method - Redraws the form or grid. Property of: Form, Grid, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .refresh() - <oRef> = The object to refresh
ADO Method - Listed, not documented. Property of: ADOErrorArray, ADOParameterArray, ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .refresh() - <oRef> = The object to refresh
Method - Refreshes any controls that are dataLinked to the current row. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .refreshControls() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to refresh.
Method - Refreshes data in the current row. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .refreshRow() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to refresh.

Method - Rebuilds a Standard tableâs indexes from scratch. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .reindex(<table name expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which the table exists. <table name expC> - The name of the table you want to reindex.
Xbase - Returns the link expression defined with the SET RELATION command.

Method - Explicitly releases an object from memory. Property of: All form objects; all report objects except Band and StreamFrame. Usage: <oRef> .release() - <oRef> = An object reference to the object you want to release.
Method - Deletes all tree items in the tree. Property of: TreeView Usage: <oRef> .releaseAllChildren() - <oRef> = The TreeView object you want to clear.
Method - Deletes all elements from an associative array. Property of: AssocArray Usage: <oRef> .removeAll() - <oRef> = A reference to the associative array you want to empty.

Method - Deletes an element from an associative array. Property of: AssocArray Usage: <oRef> .removeKey(<key expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the associative array that contains the key. <key expC> - The key value of the element you want to delete.

Method - Renames a file on disk. Property of: File Usage:<oRef> .rename(<filename expC> , <new name expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. See OLH for further information. <filename expC> - Identifies the file to rename (also known as the source file). <new name expC> - Identifies the new name for the source file (also known as the target file).

Method - Renames a table in a database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .renameTable(<old name expC> , <new name expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which to rename the table. <old name expC> - The current name of the table. <new name expC> - The new name of the table.
Method - Renders the reports to the designated target. Property of: Report Usage: <oRef> .render() - <oRef> = An object reference to the report you want to render.

Method - Copies the contents of a file into a BLOB field. Property of: Field Usage: <oRef> .replaceFromFile(<file name expC> [,<append expL> ]) - <oRef> = The BLOB field you want to copy into. <file name expC> - The name of the file you want to copy. [<append expL> ] - Whether to append the new data or overwrite.

ADO Method - Copies data from external file to BLOB field. Listed, semi-documented. Property of: ADOField Usage: <oRef> .replaceFromFile(<file name expC> [,<append expL> ]) - <oRef> = The BLOB field you want to copy into. <file name expC> - The name of the file you want to copy. [<append expL> ] - Whether to append the new data or overwrite.

ADO Method - Copies data from stream object to BLOB field. Property of: ADOField Usage: <oRef> .replaceFromStream(<stream expO> ) - <oRef> = BLOB Field to copy into. <stream expO> - Stream Object to copy into BLOB Field.

Method - Returns a string repeated a specified number of times. Property of: String Usage: <oRef> .replicate(<expC> [, <expN> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to a String object. <expC> - The string you want to repeat. [<expN> ] - The number of times to repeat the string; by default, 1.
Strings - Returns a string repeated a specified number of times.
Method - Re-executes the query or stored procedure, regenerating the rowset. Property of: Query, StoredProc Usage: <oRef> .requery() - <oRef> = The query or stored procedure you want to re-execute.

Method - Sets the size of an array to the specified dimensions and returns a numeric value representing the number of elements in the modified array. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .resize(<rows expN> [,<cols expN> [, <retain values expN> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the array whose size you want to change. <rows expN> - The number of rows the resized array should have. <rows expN> must always be a positive, nonzero value. [<cols expN> - The number of columns the resized array should have. <cols expN> must always be 0 or a positive value. If you omit this option, resize( ) changes the number of rows in the array and leaves the number of columns the same. [<retain values expN> ]] - Determines what happens to the values of the array when rows are added or removed. If it is nonzero, values are retained. If you want to specify a value for <retain values expN> , you must also specify a value for <new cols expN> .
Extending dBASE Plus - Returns a character string from a DLL file.
ADO Method - Listed, not documented Property of: ADOTableDef Usage: <oRef> .restructure() - <oRef> = ADOTableDef object

Method - Returns characters from the end of a character string. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .right(<expN> ) - <expC> = The string from which you want to extract characters. <expN> - The number of characters to extract from the string.
Strings - Returns characters from the end of a character string.
Method - Returns a string with no trailing space characters. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .rightTrim( ) - <expC> = The string from which you want to remove the trailing space characters.
Xbase - Locks the current record or a specified list of records in the current or specified table.
Xbase - Locks the current record or a specified list of records in the current or specified table.
Method - Cancels the transaction by undoing all logged changes. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .rollback() - <oRef> = The database whose changes you want to rollback.
Xbase - Cancels the transaction by undoing all logged changes.
ADO Method - Cancels the transaction by undoing all logged changes. Property of: ADODatabase Usage: <oRef> .rollback() - <oRef> = The database whose changes you want to rollback.
Math/Money - Returns a specified number rounded to the nearest integer or a specified number of decimal places.
Method - Returns the logical row count. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .rowCount() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to count.
Method - Returns the current logical row number in the rowset. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .rowNo() - <oRef> = The rowset containing the current row.
Math/Money - Returns the degree value of an angle measured in radians.
Strings - Returns a string with no trailing space characters.
Files and Operating System - Executes a program or operating system command from within dBASE, returning the instance handle of the program.
Method - Saves the current row buffer. Property of: Rowset, ArrayRowset Usage: <oRef> .save() - <oRef> = The rowset you want to save.
ADO Method - Saves current row. Method is listed, but not documented, in OLH. Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .save() - <oRef> = <object referred to>
Method - Saves changes to the current record in the currently active table. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .saveRecord() - <oRef> = An object reference to the form.

ADO Method - Saves the contents of a rowset to a file. See OLH. Listed, not documented. Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .saveToFile(<file expC> [,<format expC> ]) - <oRef> = An object reference to the ADORowset. <file expC> - filename to save to. [<format expC> ] - Listed, not documented. See saveToStream for guidance

ADO Method - Saves the binary contents of a stream object to a file. Listed, not documented. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef> .saveToFile(<name expC> ) - <oRef> = An object reference to the Stream. <name expC> - filename to save to.

ADO Method - Saves the contents of a rowset to stream object. See OLH for information. Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .saveToStream(<stream expO> [,<format expC> ]) - <oRef> = The rowset you want to save. <stream expO> - The pointer to stream [<format expC> ] - The name of the format in which the rowset is to be saved.

Method - Searches an array for an expression. Returns the number of the first element that matches the expression if the search is successful, or 0 if the search is unsuccessful. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .scan(<exp> [, <starting element expN> [, <elements expN> ]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the array you want to search. <exp> - The expression you want to search for in <oRef> . [<starting element expN> - The element number in <oRef> at which you want to start searching. Without <starting element expN> , scan( ) starts searching at the first element. [<elements expN> ]] - The number of elements in <oRef> that scan( ) searches. Without <elements expN> , scan( ) searches <oRef> from <starting element expN> to the end of the array. If you want to specify a value for <elements expN> , you must also specify a value for <starting element expN> .
ADO Method - Returns an ADORowset object containing metadata for the rowset. Property of: ADORowset Usage: <oRef> .schema() - <oRef> = An object reference to the ADORowset.

Method - Gives the appearance of scrolling the client area, of a form or subform, by moving the form's border window over the form's client area. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .scroll(<horizontal expN> ,<vertical expN> ) - <oRef> = An object reference to the Form or SubForm. <horizontal expN> - Horizontal position of top left corner of the formâs client area. <vertical expN> - Vertical position of top left corner of the formâs client area.
Date and Time - Returns the number of seconds that have elapsed on your computer's system clock since midnight.

Method - Moves the file pointer in a file previously opened with create( ) or open( ), and returns the new position of the file pointer. Property of: FILE Usage: <oRef>.seek(<offset expN> [, <position expN>]) - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file.

Xbase - Searches for the first record in an indexed table whose key fields matches the specified expression or expression list. See OLH for SEEK usage
Method - Makes the tree item the selected item in the tree. Property of: TreeItem Usage: <oRef> .select() - <oRef> = An object reference to the tree item you want to select.
LocalSQL - Retrieves data from one or more tables. See OLH for SELECT usage.
Xbase - Returns the number of an available work area or the work area number associated with a specified alias.
Xbase - Command - Sets the current work area in which to open or perform operations on a table.

Method - Returns the currently selected item(s) in an object, or checks if a specified item is selected. Property of: Grid, ListBox Usage: <oRef> .selected([<item expN> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to the object you want to check. [<item expN> ] - The item number to check. If omitted, the currently selected item(s) are returned. This parameter is allowed only for the ListBox control; the Grid method takes no parameters.
Core Language - Returns the current setting of a SET command or function key.

Method - Makes the tree item visible as the first (topmost) in the tree view. Property of: TreeItem Usage: <oRef> .setAsFirstVisible() - <oRef> = An object reference to the tree item you want to display.

Method - Assigns a new value to the byte at the specified index in the string. Property of: String Usage: <oRef> .setByte(<index expN> , <value expN> ) - <oRef> = A reference to the String object that youâre using as a structure. <index expN> - The index number of the byte to set. The first byte is at index number zero. <value expN> - The new byte value, from 0 to 255.
Method - Sets day of month. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setDate(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose day you want to change. <expN> - The day of month number, normally between 1 and 31.
Method - Sets focus to a component. Property of: Form and all form components that get focus Usage: <oRef> .setFocus() - <oRef> = A reference to the object to receive focus.
Method - Sets hours portion of time. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setHours(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose hours you want to change. <expN> - The hour number, normally between 0 and 23.

Method - Sets minutes portion of time. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setMinutes(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose minutes you want to change. <expN> - The minute number, normally between 0 and 59.

Method - Sets month of year. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setMonth(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose month you want to change. <expN> - The month number, normally between 0 and 11: 0 for January, 1 for February, and so on, up to 11 for December.
ADO Method - Listed, not documented. Property of: ADOUser Usage: <oRef> .setPermissions() - <oRef> = An object reference to the ADOUser.

Method - Constrains the rowset to those rows whose key field values falls within a range. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .setRange(<key exp> ) - <oRef> = The rowset you want to constrain. <key exp> - Shows only those rows whose key value matches <key exp> .

Method - Constrains the rowset to those rows whose key field values falls within a range. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .setRange(<startKey exp> | null, <endKey exp> | null ) - <oRef> = The rowset you want to constrain. See OLH for usage information of this use. <startKey exp> - Shows those rows whose key value is equal to or greater than <startKey exp> . <endKey exp> - Shows those rows whose key value is less than or equal to <endKey exp> .

Method - Sets seconds portion of time. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setSeconds(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose seconds you want to change. <expN> - The number of seconds, normally between 0 and 59.
Method - Manually sets a tic mark in a Slider object. Property of: Slider Usage: <oRef> .setTic(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Slider object whose tic mark to set. <expN> - The location of the tic mark.

Method - Sets date/time of Date object. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setTime(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose time you want to set. <expN> - The number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT for the desired date/time.

Method - Sets year of date. Property of: Date Usage: <oRef> .setYear(<expN> ) - <oRef> = The Date object whose year you want to change. <expN> - The year. For years in the range 1950 to 2049, you can specify the year as either a 2-digit or 4-digit year.

Method - Returns the short (8.3) name of a file. Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .shortName(<filename expC> ) - <oRef> = A reference to a File object. <filename expC> - The name of the file to check. See OLH for further information.
Method - Displays or hides the Format toolbar. Property of: Form, SubForm Usage: <oRef> .showFormatBar(<expL> ) - <oRef> = A Form object. <expL> - true to show the toolbar, false to hide the toolbar.

ADO Method - Skips a line when reading a text stream. Listed, not well documented. Property of: ADOStream Usage: <oRef> .skipLine() - <oRef> = The stream object.

Method - Sorts the elements in a one-dimensional array or the rows in a two-dimensional array. Returns 1 if successful; generates an error if unsuccessful. See OLH for futher information on usage. Property of: Array Usage: <oRef> .sort([<starting element expN> [,<elements to sort expN> [, <sort order expN> ]]]) - <oRef> = A reference to the array you want to sort. [<starting element expN> - In a one-dimensional array, the number of the element in <oRef> at which you want to start sorting. In a two-dimensional array, the number (subscript) of the column on which you want to sort. [<elements to sort expN> - In a one-dimensional array, the number of elements you want to sort. In a two-dimensional array, the number of rows to sort. [<sort order expN> ]]] - The sort order: 0 specifies ascending order (the default) 1 specifies descending order
Method - Sorts child tree items. Property of: TreeItem, TreeView Usage: <oRef> .sortChildren() - <oRef> = The tree object whose children to sort.

Miscellaneous Language Elements - Returns the most recent server error message.

Method - Returns a string with specified characters removed and others inserted in their place. [<replacement expC> ] - The characters you want to insert in the string. By default, this is an empty string.

Strings - Returns a substring derived from a specified character string.

Method - Returns a substring derived from a specified character string. Property of: String Usage: <expC> .substring(<index1 expN> , <index2 expN> ) - <expC> = The string you want to extract characters from. <index1 expN> - Indexes into the string, which is indexed from left to right. The first character of the string is at index 0 . <index2 expN> - and the last character is at index <expC> .length â 1.

Xbase - Command - Computes a total for specified numeric fields in the current table. See OLH for this command usage.

Method - Checks to see if a specified table exists in a database. Property of: Database Usage: <oRef> .tableExists(<table name expC> ) - <oRef> = The database in which to see if the table exists. <table name expC> - The name of the table you want to look for.

Method - Releases row and rowset locks. Property of: Rowset Usage: <oRef> .unlock() - <oRef> = The rowset that contains the lock.

LocalSQL - UPPER( ), to force a string to uppercase.
Strings - Converts all lowercase characters in a string to uppercase and returns the resulting string.

Method - Returns the number of tree items visible in the tree view area. Property of: TreeView Usage: <oRef> .visibleCount() - <oRef> = The tree view to check.

Property of: File Usage: <oRef> .write(<expC> [, <characters expN> ]) - <oRef> = A reference to the File object that created or opened the file. <expC> - The character expression to write to the specified file. [<characters expN> ] - The number of characters of the specified character expression <string expC> to write to the specified file, starting at the first character in <string expC> . If omitted, the entire string is written.
